description: Gives you access to a todo list
tutorial:
To add to your to-do list, do the ${serverprefix}todoadd command. *Ex: ${serverprefix}todoadd thing*
To add to a certain project, append the project name at the end within quotes. *Ex: ${serverprefix}todoadd thing "project"*
To create a new project, use the ${serverprefix}createproject <project name> command. This will allow you to have seperate to-do lists for different things. You can also set a different project as your default using ${serverprefix}tododefault <project name> *Ex: ${serverprefix}createproject abc, ${serverprefix}tododefault abc*
${serverprefix}todoremove and ${serverprefix}todocomplete use the numbers seen when you do the ${serverprefix}todo command. To mark an item as complete, or to remove it from the list completely, specify the number next to the item like ${serverprefix}todoremove <index>. You can also specify the project in the same way as the ${serverprefix}todoadd command. *Ex: ${serverprefix}todoremove 5*
